etymology.description: 刻(刻) (kè, "to cut") refers to carving or engraving, often suggesting precision or severity. 薄(薄) (bó, "thin; meagre") implies lack of substance or depth.
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 刻(刻) (kè, "to cut") and 薄(薄) (bó, "thin") suggests a demeanor that is cutting or sharp in a way that lacks warmth or empathy, hence the meaning 'unkind; harsh; mean.'

examples.chinese: 她的刻薄令人胆寒(她的刻薄令人膽寒)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de kèbó lìng rén dǎn hán.

examples.chinese: 他说话直率(他說話直率)，但有时显得刻薄(但有時顯得刻薄)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shuōhuà zhíshuài, dàn yǒu shí xiǎn de kèbó.
examples.english: He speaks frankly, but sometimes he appears mean.

examples.chinese: 他的刻薄使朋友远离(他的刻薄使朋友遠離)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de kèbó shǐ péngyǒu yuǎn lí.
